words.ENTRY: <H>fabric</H><audio>fabric.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>(a type of) cloth:</D> <bracket>countable</bracket><X>cotton fabrics</X>

familynoun(plural families) 1.countablea group of people who are closely related to each other and who usually live together: There are four people in my family.the Wilson family2.countable, uncountable(a group of) people who are related to somebody: uncountableDo you have any family in the area?
a family reunion

fancyadjectivenot simple or ordinary: a fancy restaurant
I just want a regular pair of blue jeans, nothing fancy.
<H>fantastic</H><audio>fantastic.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>very good; excellent:</D> <X>She's a fantastic swimmer.</X><dot><X>You passed your test. Fantastic!</X>

<H>fast</H><su>1</su><audio>fast.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>able to move or act at great speed:</D> <X>a fast car/horse/worker</X><H>fast</H><su>2</su><audio>fast.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>quickly:</D> <X>Don't drive so fast.</X>
<H>father</H><audio>father.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person's male parent:</D> <X>John looks exactly like his father.</X>

<H>favorite</H><su>1</su><audio>favorite.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>liked more than any other:</D> <X>What is your favorite color?</X><dot><X>My favorite singer is Whitney Houston.</X><H>favorite</H><su>2</su><audio>favorite.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person or thing that you like more than any others:</D> <X>This restaurant is my favorite.</X><dot><X>That sweater is my husband's favorite.</X>

<H>feeling</H><audio>feeling.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><CF>a feeling (of something)</CF> <D>something that you feel in your mind or body:</D> <X>a feeling of hunger/happiness/fear/success</X><NR>2.</NR><DR>feelings</DR> <bracket>plural</bracket><D>a person's emotions:</D> <X>I don't want to hurt his feelings.</X> (= make him unhappy)<dot><X>to show/hide your feelings</X>
<H>film</H><audio>film.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a movie (usually a more serious one, with important artistic value):</D> <X>a French avant-garde film</X>

fine1adjective1.in good health, or happy and comfortable: "How are you?" "Fine, thanks.""Do you want to change places?" "No, thanks. I'm fine here."2.good enough: "Do you want some more cream in your coffee?" "No, thanks, that's fine."Don't cook anything special: a sandwich will be fine.The hotel rooms were fine but the food was terrible.3.(only before a noun) of very good quality, beautiful: a fine piece of workThat's the finest painting I've ever seen by that artist.fine2adverb (informal) very well: Don't worry. You'll do just fine.

fishnoun(plural fish or fishes) 1.countablean animal that lives, breathes and swims in water: How many fish did you catch?(formal) exotic fishes. (= types or species of fish) 2.uncountablefish as food: fresh fish

<H>fit</H><audio>fit.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS>(<DR>fitter</DR>; <DR>fittest</DR>) <D>in good physical health (especially because of exercise):</D> <X>He keeps physically fit by jogging five miles a day.</X>

<H>flight</H><audio>flight.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a trip in an airplane, etc.:</D> <X>The captain and crew hope that you enjoyed the flight.</X><dot><X>a direct flight</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>an airplane that takes you on a particular trip:</D> <X>Flight number 340 to New York is boarding now.</X> (= is ready for passengers to get on it)

flyverb(present participle flying; third person singular flies; past flew; past participle flown) 1.(used about a bird, insect, airplane, etc.) to move through the air: Penguins can't fly.a plane flying overhead2.to travel in or to carry something in an airplane, etc.: My daughter is flying (out) to Singapore next week.Supplies of food were flown (in) to the starving people.3.(used about a pilot) to control an airplane, etc.: You have to have special training to fly a jumbo jet.

<H>food</H><audio>food.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>something that people, animals or plants take into their bodies in order to keep them alive and healthy:</D> <X>Plants get food from the soil.</X><dot><X>a shortage of food</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>a particular type of food that you eat:</D> <bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>baby food</X><dot><bracket>countable</bracket><X>frozen foods</X><dot><X>health foods</X>

footnouncountable(plural feet) 1.the lowest part of the leg, below the ankle, on which a person or animal stands: What size feet do you have?big/small/wide/narrow feetShe sat by the fire and the dog sat at her feet.He went there on foot. (= walking) 2.a measure of length; 30.48 centimeters. There are 12 inches in a foot, and 3 feet in a yard: "How tall are you?" "Five foot two (inches)."

forpreposition1.(showing the person who will receive something): Here is a letter for you.Save a piece of cake for Mary.He made lunch for them.She bought some candy for the kids.2.(showing purpose or use): What's this money for?
a shampoo for dry hairLet's have eggs for breakfast.3.intended to be used by a particular group or in a particular way: It's a book for children.That chair is for guests.4.in order to help somebody/
something: What can I do for you?You should take some medicine for your cold.5.(showing a length of time): I'm going away for a few days.He was a teacher for 20 years.6.(showing a distance): He walked for ten miles.

<H>foreign</H><audio>foreign.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>belonging to or connected with a country that is not your own:</D> <X>a foreign country</X><dot><X>to learn a foreign language</X><NR>2.</NR><D>dealing with or involving other countries:</D> <X>foreign policy</X>

forestnouncountable, uncountablea large area of land
that is covered with trees: countabletropical rain forestsuncountableA large part of Canada is covered in forest.
a forest fire

forgetverb(past forgot; past participle forgotten) 1.forget about something to fail to remember something; to lose the memory of something: "Why didn't you come to the party?" "Oh, no! I completely forgot about it!"You never forget how to ride a bicycle.I forgot the telephone number.2.to fail to remember to do something: Don't forget to do your homework!3.to fail to bring something with you: When my father got to the airport, he realized he'd forgotten his passport.4.to stop thinking about something: Forget about your work and enjoy yourself!"I'm sorry I shouted at you." "Forget it." (= Don't worry about it. It’s OK.)

formnoun1.countablea particular type of something or way of doing something: Swimming is an excellent form of exercise.We never eat any form of meat.2.countable (grammar) a way of spelling or changing a word in a sentence: the irregular forms of the verbsThe plural form of "mouse" is "mice."
<H>four</H><audio>four.mp3</audio><PS>number</PS><D>4, one more than three</D>

<H>frequency</H><audio>frequency.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the rate at which something happens; the number of times something happens in a particular period:</D> <X>Fatal accidents have decreased in frequency in recent years.</X> (= There are fewer of them.)
<H>Friday</H><audio>Friday.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>the day of the week after Thursday and before Saturday</D>

<H>friend</H><audio>friend.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a person that you know and like (not a member of your family):</D> <X>Steve and I are old friends. We went to the same school.</X><dot><X>Do you know Irene Pearse? She's my best friend.</X><dot><X>One of my friends told me about this restaurant.</X>

<H>friendly</H><audio>friendly.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS>(<DR>friendlier</DR>; <DR>friendliest</DR>) <D>behaving in a kind and pleasant way; showing kindness and pleasantness:</D> <X>Everyone here has been very friendly toward us.</X><dot><X>a friendly smile</X><dot><X>a small friendly hotel</X>

<H>friendship</H><audio>friendship.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the state of being friends:</D> <X>Our relationship is based on friendship, not love.</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a relationship between people who are friends:</D> <X>lifelong friendships</X>

frompreposition1.(showing the place where somebody/
something starts or started): Has the plane from Chicago arrived yet?She comes home from work at 7 o'clock.2.(showing the time when something starts or started): Peter will be on vacation from Wednesday through Friday.The store is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.3.(showing the person who sent, gave, said, etc. something): Did you get a birthday card from John?I borrowed this jacket from my sister.a phone call from my father4.(showing the origin of somebody/something): "Where do you come from?" "I'm from Australia."

<H>fruit</H><audio>fruit.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>the part of a plant or tree that contains seeds and that is used as food:</D> <bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>Try and eat more fresh fruit and vegetables.</X><dot><X>fruit juice</X><dot><bracket>countable</bracket><X>Is a tomato a fruit or a vegetable?</X>

<H>fun</H><su>1</su><audio>fun.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>pleasure and enjoyment; an activity or a person that gives you pleasure and enjoyment:</D> <X>We had a lot of fun at the party last night.</X><dot><X>The party was a lot of fun.</X><H>fun</H><su>2</su><audio>fun.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>amusing and enjoyable:</D> <X>a fun evening</X><NR>2.</NR><D>(used about people) amusing and enjoyable to be with:</D> <X>He's a really fun guy.</X>

<H>functionality</H><audio>functionality.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the purpose that something is designed for or expected to perform:</D> <X>Design processes may be affected by the functionality of the product.</X>

funnyadjective(funnier; funniest) 1.that makes you smile or laugh: She told us a funny story.He's a really funny person.
(= He can make people laugh.) 2.strange or unusual: The engine is making a funny noise.It's funny how people never talk in elevators.

future1noun1.singularthe time that will come after the present: Who knows what will happen in the future?2.singular (also future tense) (grammar) the tense of a verb that expresses what will happen after the present future2adjective (only before a noun) of or happening in the time after the present: She met her future husband when she was still in school.What are your future plans?
